item.title: Two of Nintendo Switch 2's July Games Aren't Like The Others, But That's a Good Thing
item.description:
Despite all the hype generated by leaks and rumors in the months leading up to its release, the Nintendo Switch 2 has gotten off to a bit of a slow start. The Nintendo Switch 2 Direct in April didn't reveal quite as many first-party launch titles as one might have hoped for, given Nintendo's history of acclaimed console launch titles like Super Mario 64 and The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild . Mario Kart World for Nintendo Switch 2 has made its mark on the console's launch, but it hasn't had much first-party backup. Thankfully, Nintendo has a couple more games of its own coming down the pipeline in July.

For one, the Switch 2 will get an expanded port of Super Mario Party Jamboree , the youngest of the first Switch's range of Mario Party games. Jamboree was a hit late in the Switch's life, so it makes sense to prop up the game again on the Switch 2. For another, Donkey Kong will finally get to star in a new singleplayer game again by means of Donkey Kong Bananza. It's a bit of a shame that neither of these games were available for the Switch 2 on day one, but they'll still be invaluable to the console this July.

Donkey Kong Bananza and Super Mario Party Jamboree are Just What the Doctor Ordered

Third-Party Games Can't Carry the Switch 2 Alone

An early sales report for Nintendo Switch 2 third-party games suggests that these games are struggling to move units; Cyberpunk 2077 seems to be getting by, but lots of other games just aren't. This isn't necessarily surprising, since many of the Switch 2's third-party games, like Street Fighter 6 and Yakuza 0 , are ports of relatively old games that are already available elsewhere. It's not easy for Nintendo to encourage fans to pick up the Switch 2 when so many of its games are reruns.

Super Mario Party Jamboree Expands the Switch 2's Party Game Options

That's why July will be such a valuable month. First of all, Super Mario Party Jamboree will offer a multiplayer alternative to Mario Kart World . It may be another port, but it comes with a handful of enhancements, ranging from improved performance to new game modes and minigames that make use of the Switch 2's mouse controls and other new features. Admittedly, Jamboree 's Switch 2 edition has its own hill to climb, since some of its functions rely on the Switch 2 Camera peripheral that not every console owner opted for, but it still looks like a solid upgrade.

Donkey Kong Bananza Looks to Break Through

Donkey Kong Bananza , meanwhile, could be a huge possible draw for the Switch 2. In many ways, its 3D platforming format and emphasis on exploration feels much like a spiritual successor to the acclaimed Super Mario Odyssey -- in fact, thanks to a young Pauline playing a supporting role, it may even be a canon prequel to Odyssey . Donkey Kong Bananza looks like exactly the kind of game any console needs in its early life: a massive evolution for an established franchise that's still full of love for what came before.

Donkey Kong Bananza features an asymmetrical multiplayer mode similar to the Super Mario Galaxy games, where a second player can support Donkey Kong by firing projectiles as Pauline using mouse controls.

The Switch 2's July Games are Only the Beginning

These two games aren't the only notable July releases for the Switch 2; the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 remake launches early in the month, and Spike Chunsoft will add a new entry in the popular adventure game series AI: The Somnium Files later on. Still, first-party games are critical for any console, so Super Mario Party Jamboree 's enhanced edition and Donkey Kong Bananza could make a big difference. These kinds of games will establish Nintendo's vision for the Switch 2 and can best prove what the console is capable of, since they're specifically build with this platform in mind. Here's hoping that both Super Mario Party Jamboree and Donkey Kong Bananza stick the landing in July.

item.title: It May Not Look Like It, But Battlefield 6 and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Are Fighting Over the Same Territory
item.description:
To the surprise of almost no one, Microsoft and Activision unveiled the next installment in their annualized Call of Duty franchise, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 , at the Xbox Games Showcase a few weeks ago. The reveal of the game was met with little fanfare, since many gamers were disappointed at the fact that Microsoft presented it at the end of its event, a time slot that was normally reserved for major announcements. The Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 reveal trailer featured very little gameplay, instead focusing on a cinematic story teaser. Despite the many negative reactions to it online, the game's announcement trailer was watched by tens of millions of people, making it one of the fastest-viewed trailers in CoD history.

Contrary to its name, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is not a direct sequel to last year's Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . Instead, it is a follow-up to Call of Duty: Black Ops 2 , which was originally released in 2012. Black Ops 7 is being developed by Treyarch and Raven Software, and it's going to be set in 2035, in a world that is on the brink of all-out war. It will follow David Mason and his group of agents as they go on a "mind-bending" mission to defeat an enemy who, as Activision states, "weaponizes fear above all else."

CoD: Black Ops 7 and Battlefield 6 Are Going to be Targeting the Same Audience

For the First Time in Years, Battlefield May Pose a Serious Threat to Call of Duty

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is coming out at an interesting time for the Call of Duty franchise. In spite of the many complaints that have been thrown at it, Call of Duty has remained unrivaled in the online first-person shooter space for many years. Call of Duty 's biggest rival, the Battlefield series, has fallen out of popularity in recent times, due to the catastrophic launch of Battlefield 2042 . However, Battlefield is gearing up to make a return in the near future, and the next installment in the franchise may give Black Ops 7 a run for its money.

Battlefield 6 Seems Like It Could Be a Major Hit for EA and DICE

The next Battlefield game doesn't have an official name yet. However, unlike many of the newer entries in the Battlefield series, which opted for either sci-fi or historical settings, EA and DICE have already confirmed that it is going to take place in the near future. Reports suggest that Battlefield 6 (as it is colloquially called) will apparently follow a massive military group that's fighting against NATO, and it will take players on a journey through a number of locations around the world.

EA and DICE are going to be taking a back-to-basics approach with Battlefield 6 . They're not only employing a more traditional formula for the campaign and multiplayer modes of the next Battlefield game, they're also getting rid of many of the controversial features that were introduced in Battlefield 2042 . EA has held closed betas for Battlefield 6 over the last few months, and so far, reception has been largely positive. Battlefield 6 's full reveal will supposedly happen later this summer, and it's currently scheduled to come out before March 2026.

The Similarities Between Black Ops 7 and Battlefield 6 May Impact Their Commercial Performance

The current head of the Battlefield franchise, Vince Zampella, claimed in an interview with IGN last year that EA is not "looking to take down Call of Duty " with the next Battlefield game. Rather, the company is looking to differentiate Battlefield from Activision's long-running series. In spite of his statements, though, the similarities between Battlefield 6 and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 are hard to ignore. Since both titles are going to feature a near-future setting and will be launched only a few months apart from each other, there's going to be a lot of overlap between the target audiences for these two games. If Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 isn't as good as people are hoping for, then there's a chance that Battlefield 6 will be able to steal its thunder, even if just for a short while.

item.title: How To Beat Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw In Elden Ring Nightreign
item.description:
Gaping Jaw is the first Nightlord in Elden Ring Nightreign to receive the Everdark Sovereign version of the Expedition. This expedition is exactly the same as any other expedition in the game, except for the fact that the boss fight with Adel, Baron of Night is quite different. On top of this, the boss is now much more challenging and has a few attacks that can take out the entire team in a few seconds if they do not understand how to react to the attack.

Despite the difficulty spike, players can still strategize and beat the boss with ease if they bring along good relics and a solid team composition. Here is everything you need to know about the Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw's attack patterns and how to beat it in Elden Ring Nightreign .

Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw Overview

A Harder Version Of Adel With A New Phase & Moveset

Attack

Image

Description

Phase Two

Lightning Discharge

Adel starts to vibrate with lightning around itself, then causes a large AOE that rapidly deals damage to any player inside the area.

Purple Grab

Adel raises its head, followed by an audio cue and a purple animation that indicates an incoming jaw grab. The boss can perform the grab twice in quick succession.

Roaring Tantrum

The boss roars twice, stunning Nightfarers. It also marks one player, on whom it will perform the subsequent attacks and grabs.

Lightning Burrow Slam

Adel slams its head into the ground, causing lightning to spread out in multiple directions.

Diving Storm

The boss leaps up into the air, crashes down onto the ground, and unleashes a lightning blast all around it.

Phase Three

Cyclone Frenzy

Adel starts to dart around the arena, then lands on the ground, releasing a shockwave and changing its appearance. It starts to dart around once more, this time forming a cyclone inside the arena.

Shocking Bite

The boss tries to bite the player, creating a small shockwave around its jaw that deals lightning damage.

Underground Dive

Adel goes underground, then after a few seconds, emerges from the ground.

Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw Weaknesses

Similar to the normal expedition with Adel, Baron of Night , you must make use of Poison, Frost, Sleep, or Rot , as normal elemental damage is either neutral or the boss is resistant to it. One of the most important changes in the Everdark Sovereign version of the boss is that Poison no longer makes the boss vomit out the toxins it has digested, giving you extra time to get multiple hits in.

Poison will now only deal tick damage , but it can proc quickly because of the bosss low resistance to it. Even so, this makes it so that you should prioritize getting Frost over Poison , because not only does it do a chunk of damage, but it also lowers Adel's damage absorption by 20%.

If you are communicating with a party, you can check out all the locations with Poison, Frost, Sleep, and Rot. This allows you to have multiple weapons that can inflict different status effects on the boss , lowering its health in a number of ways.

Luckily, some of these, especially the Frost weapons, are easy to obtain, and you can even use a Relic like the Night of the Wise to have weapons start with Poison damage.

You must also utilize the Shifting Earth Events , especially the Mountaintops if you have a Frost weapon, or the Rotted Weapons to acquire a Rot weapon.

How To Beat Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw

Counters, Team Comps, & Best Strategies For Gaping Jaw (Everdark Sovereign)

The boss fight with Adel, Baron of Night, is a tough one, especially if it's your first few attempts and you do not understand how some of the new attacks work. Adel has two phases in the Everdark Sovereign version and tries its best to give a proper spectacle during the final phase of the fight.

Phase Two Strategy

The fight starts off with Adel already in its second phase from the normal version of the fight, and it will fly up into the sky before descending and slamming the ground, causing multiple lightning bursts. The boss has a habit of trying to grab the same player twice, so when you hear the first audio cue for the grab and manage to dodge it, be ready for the next one that will come momentarily. For the lightning burrow slams the boss performs throughout the fight, it is best to dodge the slam if you are in the radius and jump up to avoid the lightning damage from the explosion.

The first phase of this fight is still manageable, and you must focus on bringing down its health without using too many flasks . Make use of Frostbite and Poison to whittle its health down, and if you can Stance-Break the boss, be sure to dash in to get the Critical Hit.

Phase Three Strategy

The fight takes a drastic turn when the boss loses around 50% of its health and starts to power up and fly rapidly across the arena, making it extremely hard to follow its movement. Your best bet here is to run to the side of the boss arena and prepare for the boss to form the Cyclone, which is a key aspect of this phase. Everything outside the Cyclone will take lightning damage, and the entrance of the Cyclone has fast-moving winds mixed with lightning that can shred your health bar. There is only one way to get inside the Cyclone, and that is to make use of the numerous Spiritsprings around the Cyclone .

As players approach the Spiritsprings, they should take a few seconds to heal themselves and apply buffs before launching themselves upward and into the mouth of the Cyclone, where Adel is waiting eagerly. The boss will now be more aggressive , trying to chomp you with its lightning bite attacks. Adel will also start doing more slam attacks, making the limited area explode with lightning damage.

In some cases, the boss might go underground and burst out, dealing damage to anyone above where it emerges. Make sure you are moving around the arena to avoid being targeted by the boss for this attack. If one of your teammates dies outside the Cyclone, you must not go out to revive them and should prioritize dealing with the boss . This is because exiting the Cyclone is not an option, and waiting for the teammates to crawl back into the Cyclone is the only viable choice.

Best Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw Team Comps

The best team comp for the Gaping Jaw is Ironeye, Wylder, and Raider. This team composition brings everything to the table. You have the required damage to cut down the boss's health bar, and more importantly, you have enough stagger to Stance-Break the boss multiple times.

All these Nightfarers have ultimates that can interrupt normal attacks from Adel and should be used in tough spots while also trying to damage the boss. Because of Adel's third phase, players must have mobility , which only the Raider lacks, so players can switch him out for an additional Ironeye. If you still want to bring along Raider, then be sure to have a weapon with the Endure skill to use when the boss starts the Lightning Discharge attack.

You can opt for different Nightfarers, but given the boss's weaknesses, these characters shine more, especially if you can bring along a Poison and Frost weapon with you.

Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw Rewards

What Do You Get For Beating Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw?

Defeating Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw for the first time will reward you with 25 Sovereign Sigils that you can use at the Collector's Signboard to purchase Skins , Vessels , and Relics . One of the Relics, Dark Night of the Baron , has the following effects:

  • Improved Critical Hits +1
  • Improved Critical Hits
  • Critical Hits Earn Runes

Completing more Expeditions for Everdark Sovereign Gaping Jaw will reward the player with 5 Sovereign Sigils.

Players can also change the Shifting Earth Events using the Sovereign Sigils from the Signboard after they have defeated the Everdark Sovereign boss for the first time.

item.title: June 21 Is Suddenly a Big Day for Borderlands 4
item.description:
Borderlands 4 is getting an official story trailer on June 21, 2K has announced. Somewhat unexpectedly, this latest look at Borderlands 4 won't premiere on YouTube.

2K and Gearbox originally announced Borderlands 4 during the August 2024 edition of Gamescom. Since then, the game has received "Official First Look," "Official Launch Date," and "Official Gameplay" trailers, as well as a 20-minute gameplay deep dive.

Another look at the upcoming looter shooter has now been scheduled for this Saturday, June 21, when Borderlands 4 will receive its official story trailer. The video is planned to premiere at 12:45pm PT / 3:45pm ET / 9:45pm CET. According to 2K's official announcement of the event, the premiere will only be viewable via the official Borderlands Twitch channel and the Borderlands 4 Steam page. Once the livestream is over, the video will likely make its way to other platforms, including the series' YouTube channel.

Borderlands 4 Story Trailer Premiere Overview

  • Premiere date : June 21
  • Premiere time : 12:45pm PT / 3:45pm ET / 9:45pm CET
  • Where to watch : Borderlands Twitch channel, Borderlands 4 Steam page

As for the trailers contents, the publisher offered few specifics but confirmed it will feature guns, bosses, explosions, and longtime Borderlands character Mad Moxxi. No runtime information has been provided in advance, but based on the game's previously shared promo videosexcept for the late April 2025 gameplay deep divethe official story trailer will presumably be several minutes long.

2K Is Giving Away a New Borderlands Twitch Badge on June 21

The video itself will debut as part of the latest edition of Borderlands Fan Fest. The upcoming event will also feature new hands-on gameplay footage captured by popular content creators, showcasing Borderlands 4 s planet of Kairos. During the event, fans will be able to unlock a new Vault Symbol Twitch badge. The digital item will be distributed via Twitch Drops, requiring 30 minutes of total watch time to claim. As is typical with such promotions, active viewing isn't necessarysimply having a supported stream open, even if muted in the background, will count toward the 30-minute unlock requirement.

While Borderlands 4 was initially targeting a September 23 release, its launch was later rescheduled for September 12. The fourth mainline installment in the looter shooter series will be available day-one on the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PCvia both Steam and the Epic Games Store. A Nintendo Switch 2 port is also in the works, but is still waiting for an official release date. This wait shouldn't be too long, as 2K previously confirmed that Nintendo's latest console is planned to receive Borderlands 4 before the end of 2025.

item.title: How to Complete Water Fat in Dune Awakening
item.description:
Dune: Awakening has plenty of activities to complete after ending the game, and one of them is the Epilogue Quest and Elara Tuek's Assassination tasks. One of those missions is Water Fat, a complicated infiltration task that will make even the most patient player grit their teeth as they try to infiltrate the manor of a local Water Shipper.

In this full walkthrough, players will find all the information they need to complete the Water Fat mission, including the best possible infiltration route inside the Water Shipper's Manor, and how to avoid the annoying spotlights.

How to Start Water Fat in Dune Awakening

To start the Water Fat mission in Dune: Awakening, players will need to speak to Elara Tuek to grab their next assassination contract. She will tell them about a Water Shipper near Arrakeen, that needs to be taken down, and give them a poison injector to contaminate his water supply.

Before proceeding, make sure to bring a Cutteray, a JABAAL Spitdart Sniper (or better) with enough Heavy Darts, a Suspensor belt like the Emperor Wings, and a mobility skill like Bindu Sprint or Shigawire Claw.

To proceed with the mission, finish talking with Elara and travel to world map with an Ornithopter then press M to locate the Water Shipper's Manor , which right outside Arrakeen. Fly to the location indicated in the map and approach the node to enter with the Ornithopter.

How to Infiltrate the Manor

After a brief cutscene, players will be debriefed by Elara Tuek on what they need to do. The map is a huge fortress filled with guards with snipers , patrolling troopers , and enormous reflectors that scour the zone and track the player, then launch an alarm and trap them on sight. The reflectors will spot players, paralize them, and send them back to the starting point, so watch how they move and avoid the light .

Reflector light will make a distinctive noise when it detects the players, and they will have 1.5 seconds to either escape or hide away from the light, or they will be paralyzed and sent to the checkpoint.

To breach into the fortress, look for the scaffolding in the right side of the wall from the spawning point, then run using Bindu Sprint or Shigawire Claw to avoid the reflector and reach the stairs. Climb on top of the wall to the first checkpoint , then Elara will tell the players to look for her contact inside the manor.

First Checkpoint and Elara's Contact Location

The NPC named Yargun can be found standing between the paths of two reflectors, standing on a platform right in the open. But players need to dispose of two enemies patrolling the zone using a long range weapon before approaching to speak with him.

If enemy soldiers detect players, a countdown of 30 seconds will begin, and after that they will be sent to the nearest checkpoint. To avoid this, kill the enemies that are engaged in combat and hide in the shadows. If the countdown doesn't dissappear means that there's another enemy spotting them from afar, so snipe them out.

After that, he will tell them that they need to either find a hidden cave to enter the manor through the underground, or go right above him to avoid some reflectors and kill their way inside. That's the most dangerous approach, and will require avoiding more reflectors and sniping the guards. So the recommended path lies to the left of the NPC , across the poppy fields and into the entrance to the Underground Passage.

Looking For The Underground Passage

Players should choose the underground infiltration approach to speed things up. Once they finish speaking with Yargu, head to the left side of the Poppy field, avoiding the reflectors and killing the guards with a sniper to avoid detection. There's a tunnel intersection where players can hide to wait for the two reflectors to pass, and kill the enemy standing guard on the cave entrance with a sniper while they wait. Once the two lights are away, make a run for it and enter the cave.

Players will find a blast door that needs to be opened with a cutteray. If they happened to have forgotten their cutterays, there are a few scrap metal pieces laying on the floor nearby, so players can grab them and craft a makeshift cutteray. Once inside the cave tunnel, avoid the toxic gas mines and keep moving forward until the first fork , then turn left to reach a dead end . If players enter from the opposite side, they will still reach a the same dead end at some point, if they stumble with another blast door, then they should backtrack and find the dead end to proceed.

Now look at the stone of the dead end closely, grab the Cutteray and scan it for structural instability. Cut through the lines to break the rock and proceed forward through another tunnel. Watch out for the quicksand puddles , keep close to the walls to step on the small rocks and avoid sinking.

How to Reach The Water Container to Inject the Poison

Once on the end of the new tunnel, grab the Cutteray one last time to break the rock wall and enter a new stealth zone. There will be more reflectors and more guards . Snipe the guards, stick to the right and avoid all the lights, then keep close to the wall until finding a door. Cross the door to find the next stealth area, kill the guard patrolling the middle and dash through the two reflectors to the next door. In the next zone, there will be the objective of the mission: The water container players need to poison .

Approach the water container and interact with it to see a cutscene , where the Water Shipper will appear, revealing an uncomfortable truth to the players and making them doubt their allegiance. Once the target is dead, the alarms will go off , and the guards will rush to kill the players. Don't fight , just run outside the room , then to the right and cross the field to the landing pad on the right, board the Ornithopter to finish the mission. Once back in Harko Village, players will receive their rewards and will be able to debrief Elara Tuek for the next and last of the Assassination Contracts.
